description: Welcome to our restaurant! We offer a wide range of specialties that include seafood, fish, steaks, oriental curries & takeaway. We have been in operation since Nov. 1982, apart from a brief spell of three years between 2008 and 2010 when we were closed for major renovation. We now have a very well structured restaurant with an air conditioned dining hall which can hold a conference for about 80 pax and various levels of sea view terraces where you can sit comfortably day or night and enjoy our truly mouthwatering cuisine. Our fully stocked bar will serve you with cold drinks, wines and spirits and fresh juices to accompany your meal. The atmosphere is relaxing with piped background music. You can approach us either from the Mombasa - Malindi Highway or directly from the beach through our well-built beach steps at low tide. We can accommodate your next catering event. Our well trained chefs will be at hand for any occasion such as special birthday parties, wedding or company parties.

address: Malindi Road Malindi Road, Bamburi Beach, Mombasa, Bamburi, Mombasa 80101 Kenya
description: Our Imani Dhow is a so-called Zanzibar Jahazi that was built over 45 years ago. In the past it weighed about 90 tons and on its way between Zanzibar, Dar-es-Saalam, Tanja and Mombasa it transported diverse products like cotton or corn and many more. Under the skilled hands of her former Bajuni Crew of 16 sailors it became a just beautiful sailing ship. Imani means "trust" and our dhow paid this trust back during her active years and survived all storms and dangers. Today the Imani Dhow is home to our great kitchen crew who will enthuse you with culinary highlights. Here you will enjoy award-winning à la carte fish dishes, fine seafood in diverse variations and also international cuisine. A warm welcome aboard!
name: Imani Dhow Restaurant

address: Mwembe Tayari Road, Mombasa 80100 Kenya
description: In April 1962, as Mombasa was growing into one of East Africa's busiest ports, Dalip Singh Wilkhu had a vision. While working as a signal operator for East African Railways, he was inspired to feed arriving visitors while preparing packaged meals for those preparing to depart. Singh Restaurant was born. Since then, Singh Restaurant has fed generations of people from various walks of life... Providing lunches and dinners for entire groups of workers, for families, for individuals... And becoming one of the most popular tourist destinations in the region, and drawing visitors from nearby cities such as Nairobi and Dar es Salaam. Our success comes from high quality in all aspects of our business, from the food we serve, to our operational efficiency, to the atmosphere we provide our visitors from the moment they walk in, until the moment they depart. Our quality of food and quality of service has helped Singh Restaurant gain recognition as the most highly recommended Indian restaurant in Mombasa by sources including TripAdvisor and Lonely Planet.
name: Singh Restaurant
